text: These be the words which Moses spake unto all Israel, on this side Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain, over against the red sea, between Paran and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are eleven days’ journey from Horeb unto Kadesh Barnea, by the way of mount Seir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in the first day of the eleventh month, in the fortieth year that Moses spake unto the children of Israel according unto all that the Lord hath given him in commandment unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he had slain Sihon the King of the Amorites which dwelt in Heshbon, and Og king of Bashan, which dwelt at Ashtaroth in Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: On this side Jordan at the land of Moab began Moses to declare this law, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough in this mount,
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn you and depart, and go unto the mountain of the Amorites, and unto all places near thereunto in the plain, in the mountain, or in the valley: both Southward, and to the Sea side to the land of the Canaanites, and unto Lebanon: even unto the great river, the river Perah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess that land which the Lord sware, unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give unto them and unto their seed after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I spake unto you the same time, saying, I am not able to bear you myself alone:
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God hath multiplied you: and behold, ye are this day as the stars of heaven in number:
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Lord God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promised you,)
speaker: Narrator

text: How can I alone bear your cumbrance and your charge, and your strife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring you men of wisdom and of understanding, and known among your tribes, and I will make them rulers over you:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he answered me and said, the thing is good that thou hast commanded us to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the chief of your tribes, wise and known men, and made them rulers over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifty, and captains over ten, and officers among your tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I charged your Judges that same time, saying, Hear the controversies between your brethren, and judge righteously between every man and his brother, and the stranger that is with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall have no respect of person in judgment, but shall hear the small as well as the great: ye shall not fear the face of man: for the judgment is God’s: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring unto me, and I will hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I commanded you the same time all the things which ye should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we departed from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wilderness (as ye have seen) by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the Lord our God commanded us: and we came to Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the Amorites, which the Lord our God doth give unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Lord thy God hath laid the land before thee: go up and possess it, as the Lord the God of thy fathers hath said unto thee: fear not, neither be discouraged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye came unto me everyone, and said, We will send men before us, to search us out the land, and to bring us word again, what way we must go up by, and unto what cities we shall come.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the saying pleased me well, and I took twelve men of you, of every tribe one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who departed, and went up into the mountain, and came unto the river Eshcol, and searched out the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And took of the fruit of the land in their hand, and brought it unto us, and brought us word again, and said, It is a good land, which the Lord our God doth give us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, ye would not go up, but were disobedient unto the commandment of the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And murmured in your tents, and said, Because the Lord hated us, therefore hath he brought us out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, and to destroy us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whither shall we go up, our brethren have discouraged our hearts, saying, The people [are] greater, and taller than we: the cities are great and walled up to heaven: and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said unto you, Dread not, nor be afraid of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God, who goeth before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did unto you in Egypt before your eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how the Lord thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way which ye have gone, until ye came unto this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet for all this ye did not believe the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, that ye might see what way to go, and in a cloud by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely there shall not one of these men of this forward generation, see that good land, which I sware to give unto your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh: he shall see it, and to him will I give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath constantly followed the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not go in thither,
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua the son of Nun which standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: encourage him: for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, your children, which ye said should be a prey, and your sons, which in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, turn back, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the Lord, we will go up, and fight, according to all that the Lord our God hath commanded us: and ye armed you every man to the war, and were ready to go up into the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up, neither fight, (for I am not among you) lest ye fall before your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I told you, ye would not hear, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord, and were presumptuous, and went up into the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Amorites which dwelt in that mountain came out against you, and chased you (as bees used to do) and destroyed you in Seir, even unto Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye came again, ye wept before the Lord, but the Lord would not hear your voice, nor incline his ears unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So ye abode in Kadesh a long time, according to the time that ye had remained before.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness, by the way of the red Sea, as the Lord spake unto me: and were compassed mount Seir [a] long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you Northward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And warn thou the people, saying, Ye shall go through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau, which dwell in Seir, and they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed therefore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not provoke them: for I will not give you of their land so much as a foot breadth, because I have given mount Seir unto Esau for a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall buy meat of them for money to eat, and ye shall also procure water of them for money to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God hath blessed thee in all the works of thine hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great wilderness, and the Lord thy God hath been with thee this forty years, and thou hast lacked nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when we were departed from our brethren the children of Esau which dwelt in Seir: through the way of the plain, from Elath, and from Ezion Geber, we turned and went by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto me, Thou shalt not vex Moab, neither provoke them to battle: for I will not give thee of their land for a possession, because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot for a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great and many, and tall, as the Anakims.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also were taken for giants as the Anakims: whom the Moabites call Emims.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Horites also dwelt in Seir before time, whom the children of Esau chased out and destroyed them before them, and dwelt in their stead: as Israel shall do unto the land of his possession, which the Lord hath given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now rise up, said I, and get you over the river Zered: and we went over the river Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: The space also wherein we came from Kadesh Barnea, until we were come over the river Zered, was eight and thirty years, until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host, as the Lord sware unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed the hand of the Lord was against them, to destroy them from among the host, till they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt go through Ar the coast of Moab this day:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt come near over against the children of Ammon: but shalt not lay siege unto them, nor move war against them: for I will not give thee of the land of the children of Ammon any possession: for I have given it unto the children of Lot for a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: That also was taken for a land of giants: for giants dwelt therein afore time, whom the Ammonites called Zamzummims:
speaker: Narrator

text: A people that was great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims: but the Lord destroyed them before them, and they succeeded them in their inheritance, and dwelt in their stead:
speaker: Narrator

text: As he did to the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites before them, and they possessed them, and dwelt in their stead unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Avim which dwelt in Hazarim even unto Azzah, the Caphtorims which came out of Caphtor destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise up therefore, said the Lord: take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon: behold, I have given into thy hand Sihon, the Amorite, King of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possess it, and provoke him to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day will I begin to send thy fear and thy dread, upon all people under the whole heaven, which shall hear thy fame, and shall tremble and quake before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon King of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me pass through thy land: I will go by the highway: I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt sell me meat for money, for to eat, and shalt give me water for money for to drink: only I will go through on my foot,
speaker: Narrator

text: (As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites which dwell in Ar, did unto me) until I be come over Jordan, into the land which the Lord our God giveth us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon the King of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the Lord thy God had hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, because he would deliver him into thine hand, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess and inherit his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came out Sihon to meet us, himself with all his people to fight at Jahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord our God delivered him into our power, and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we took all his cities the same time, and destroyed every city, men, and women, and children: we let nothing remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the cattle we took to ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is by the bank of the river of Arnon, and from the city that is upon the river, even unto Gilead: there was not one city that escaped us: for the Lord our God delivered up all before us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not, nor unto any place of the river Jabbok, nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever the Lord our God forbade us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned, and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og King of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people to fight at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, Fear him not, for I will deliver him, and all his people, and his land into thine hand, and thou shalt do unto him as thou diddest unto Sihon King of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord our God delivered also unto our hand, Og the King of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him, until none was left him alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we took all his cities the same time, neither was there a city which we took not from them, even three score cities, and all the country of Argob, even the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these cities were fenced with high walls, gates and bars, beside unwalled towns a great many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we overthrew them, as we did unto Sihon King of Heshbon, destroying every city, with men, women, and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the cattle and the spoil of the cities we took for ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus we took at that time out of the hand of two Kings of the Amorites, the land that was on this side Jordan from the river of Arnon unto mount Hermon:
speaker: Narrator

text: (Which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion, but the Amorites call it Senir)
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan unto Salcah, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: For only Og King of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Giants, whose bed was a bed of iron: is it not at Rabbath among the children of Ammon? the length thereof is nine cubits, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this land which we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which is by the river Arnon, and half mount Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and Gadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh: even all the country of Argob with all Bashan, which is called, The land of giants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the country of Argob, unto the coasts of Geshuri, and of Maachathi: and called them after his own name, Bashan, Havoth Jair unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I gave part of Gilead unto Machir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the Reubenites and Gadites I gave the rest of Gilead, and unto the river of Arnon, half the river and the borders, even unto the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon:
speaker: Narrator

text: The plain also and Jordan, and the borders from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, to wit, the salt Sea under the springs of Pisgah Eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded you the same time, saying, The Lord your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall go over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all men of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wives only, and your children, and your cattle (for I know that ye have much cattle) shall abide in your cities, which I have given you,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until the Lord have given rest unto your brethren as unto you, and that they also possess the land, which the Lord your God hath given them beyond Jordan: then shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I charged Joshua the same time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the Lord your God hath done unto these two Kings: so shall the Lord do unto all the kingdoms whither thou goest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not fear them: for the Lord your God, he shall fight for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I besought the Lord the same time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God, thou hast begun to show thy servant thy greatness and thy mighty hand: for where is there a God in heaven or in earth, that can do like thy works, and like thy power?
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee let me go over and see the good land that is beyond Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord was angry with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the Lord said unto me, Let it suffice thee, speak no more unto me of this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get thee up into the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes Westward, and Northward, and Southward, and Eastward, and behold it with thine eyes, for thou shalt not go over this Jordan:
speaker: Narrator

text: But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and bolden him: for he shall go before this people, and he shall divide for inheritance unto them, the land which thou shalt see.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we abode in the valley over against Beth Peor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the ordinances and to the laws which I teach you to do, that ye may live and go in, and possess the land, which the Lord God of your fathers giveth you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall put nothing unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye take ought there from, that ye may keep the commandments of the Lord your God which I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes have seen what the Lord did because of Baal Peor, for all the men that followed Baal Peor, the Lord thy God hath destroyed every one from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye that did cleave unto the Lord your God, are alive every one of you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have taught you ordinances, and laws, as the Lord my God commanded me, that ye should do even so within the land whither ye go to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep them therefore, and do them: for that is your wisdom, and your understanding in the sight of the people, which shall hear all these ordinances, and shall say, Only this people is wise, and of understanding, and a great nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what nation is so great, unto whom the gods come so near unto them, as the Lord our God is, near unto us, in all that we call unto him for?
speaker: Narrator

text: And what nation is so great, that hath ordinances and laws so righteous, as all this Law, which I set before you this day?
speaker: Narrator

text: But take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, that thou forget not the things which thine eyes have seen, and that they depart not out of thine heart, all the days of thy life: but teach them thy sons, and thy sons’ sons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Forget not the day that thou stoodest before the Lord thy God in Horeb, when the Lord said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will cause them to hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came you near and stood under the mountain, and the mountain burnt with fire unto the midst of heaven, and there was darkness, clouds and mist.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto you out of the midst of the fire, and ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude, save a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he declared unto you his covenant which he commanded you to do, even the ten commandments, and wrote them upon two Tables of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord commanded me that same time, that I should teach you ordinances and laws, which ye should observe in the land, whither ye go, to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take therefore good heed unto your selves: for ye saw no image in the day that the Lord spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire:
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye corrupt not yourselves, and make you a graven image, or representation of any figure: whether it be the likeness of male or female,
speaker: Narrator

text: The likeness of any beast that is on earth, or the likeness of any feathered fowl that flieth in the air:
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the likeness of anything that creepeth on the earth, or the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun and the moon and the stars with all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them and serve them, which the Lord thy God hath distributed to all people under the whole heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord hath taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt to be unto him a people and inheritance, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord was angry with me for your words, and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that I should not go in unto that good land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I must die in this land, and shall not go over Jordan: but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the Lord your God which he made with you, and lest ye make you any graven image, or likeness of anything, as the Lord thy God hath charged thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God is a consuming fire, and a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt beget children and children’s children, and shalt have remained long in the land, if ye corrupt yourselves, and make any graven image, or likeness of anything, and work evil in the sight of the Lord thy God, to provoke him to anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth to record against you this day, that ye shall shortly perish from the land, whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it: ye shall not prolong your days therein, but shall utterly be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall scatter you among the people, and ye shall be left few in number among the nations, whither the Lord shall bring you:
speaker: Narrator

text: And there ye shall serve gods: even the work of man’s hand, wood, and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if from thence thou shalt seek the Lord thy God, thou shalt find him, if thou seek him with all thine heart, and with all thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, at the length, if thou return to the Lord thy God, and be obedient unto his voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord thy God is a merciful God) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers, which he sware unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For inquire now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and ask from the one end of heaven unto the other, if there came to pass such a great thing as this, or whether any such like thing hath been heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did ever people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of a fire, as thou hast heard, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from among nations, by tentations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great fear, according unto all that the Lord your God did unto you in Egypt before your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto thee it was showed, that thou mightest know that the Lord he is God, and that there is none but he alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of heaven he made thee hear his voice to instruct thee, and upon earth he showed thee his great fire, and thou heardest his voice out of the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and hath brought thee out of Egypt in his sight by his mighty power,
speaker: Narrator

text: To thrust out nations greater and mightier than thou, before thee, to bring thee in, and to give thee their land for inheritance: as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand therefore this day, and consider in thine heart, that the Lord he is God in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: there is none other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep therefore his ordinances, and his commandments which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days upon the earth, which the Lord thy God giveth thee forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses separated three cities on this side of Jordan toward the sun rising:
speaker: Narrator

text: That the slayer should flee thither, which had killed his neighbor at unawares, and hated him not in time past, might flee, I say, unto one of those cities, and live:
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country of the Reubenites: and Ramoth in Gilead among the Gadites: and Golan in Bashan among them of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the witnesses, and the ordinances, and the laws which Moses declared to the children of Israel after they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: On this side Jordan, in the valley over against Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon King of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come out of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they possessed his land, and the land of Og King of Bashan, two Kings of the Amorites, which were on this side Jordan toward the sun rising:
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto mount Sion, which is Hermon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the plain from Jordan Eastward, even unto the Sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses called all Israel, and said unto them, Hear, O Israel, the ordinances and the laws which I propose to you this day, that ye may learn them, and take heed to observe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord made not this covenant with our fathers only, but with us, even with us all here alive this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord talked with you face to face in the Mount, out of the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: (At that time I stood between the Lord and you, to declare unto you the word of the Lord: for ye were afraid at the sight of the fire, and went not up into the mount) and he said,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have none other gods before my face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make thee no graven image or any likeness of that that is in heaven above, or which is in the earth beneath, or that is in the waters under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt neither bow thyself unto them, nor serve them: for I the Lord thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, even unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me:
speaker: Narrator

text: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take the Name of the Lord thy God in vain: for the Lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh his Name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep the Sabbath day to sanctify it, as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt labor, and shalt do all thy work:
speaker: Narrator

text: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: thou shalt not do any work therein, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, nor thy manservant, nor thy maid, nor thine ox, nor thine ass, neither any of thy cattle, nor the stranger that is within thy gates: that thy manservant and thy maid may rest as well as thou.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and that the Lord thy God brought thee out thence by a mighty hand, and a stretched out arm: therefore the Lord thy God commanded thee to observe the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor thy father and thy mother, as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee, that thy days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with thee upon the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not kill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou bear false witness against thy neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou covet thy neighbor’s wife, neither shalt thou desire thy neighbor’s house, his field, nor his manservant, nor his maid, his ox, nor his ass, nor ought that thy neighbor hath.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words the Lord spake unto all your multitude in the mount of the midst of the fire, the cloud and the darkness, with a great voice, and added no more thereto: and wrote them upon two tables of stone, and delivered them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, (for the mountain did burn with fire) then ye came to me, all the chief of your tribes, and your Elders:
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye said, Behold, the Lord our God hath showed us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God doth talk with man, and he liveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of the Lord our God anymore, we shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what flesh was there ever that heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire as we have, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Go thou near and hear all that the Lord our God saith: and declare thou unto us all that the Lord our God saith unto thee: and we will hear it, and do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me: and the Lord said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said, all that they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that there were such an heart in them to fear me, and to keep all my commandments always: that it might go well with them, and with their children forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go, say unto them, Return you into your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: But stand thou here with me, and I will tell thee all the commandments, and the ordinances, and the laws, which thou shalt teach them: that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed therefore, that ye do as the Lord your God hath commanded you: turn not aside to the right hand nor to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: But walk in all the ways which the Lord your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may go well with you: and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: These now are the commandments, ordinances, and laws, which the Lord your God commanded me to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go to possess it:
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou mightest fear the Lord thy God, and keep all his ordinances, and his commandments which I command thee, thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son all the days of thy life, even that thy days may be prolonged:
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear therefore, O Israel, and take heed to do it, that it may go well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily in the land that floweth with milk and honey, as the Lord God of thy fathers hath promised thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Israel, The Lord our God is Lord only,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these words which I command thee this day, shall be in thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt rehearse them continually unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou tarriest in thine house, and as thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand, and they shall be as frontlets between thine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt write them upon the posts of thine house, and upon thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord thy God hath brought thee into the land, which he sware unto thy fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give to thee, with great and goodly cities which thou buildedst not,
speaker: Narrator

text: And houses full of all manner of goods which thou filledst not, and wells dug which thou dug not, vineyards and olive trees which thou plantedst not, and when thou hast eaten and art full,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware lest thou forget the Lord, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not walk after other gods, after any of the gods of the people which are round about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord thy God is a jealous God among you:) lest the wrath of the Lord thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not tempt the Lord your God, as ye did tempt him in Massah:
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall keep diligently the commandments of the Lord your God, and his testimonies and his ordinances, which he hath commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of the Lord: that thou mayest prosper, and that thou mayest go in, and possess that good land which the Lord sware unto thy fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: To cast out all thine enemies before thee, as the Lord hath said.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thy son shall ask thee in time to come, saying, What mean these testimonies, and ordinances, and Laws, which the Lord our God hath commanded you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh’s bondmen in Egypt: but the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord showed signs and wonders great and evil upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his household before our eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: And brought us out from thence, to bring us in, and to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord hath commanded us, to do all these ordinances, and to fear the Lord our God, that it may go ever well with us, and that he may preserve us alive at this present.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, this shall be our righteousness before the Lord our God, if we take heed to keep all these commandments, as he hath commanded us.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord thy God shall bring thee into the land whither thou goest to possess it, and shall root out many nations before thee: the Hittites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than thou,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God shall give them before thee, then thou shalt smite them: thou shalt utterly destroy them: thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor have compassion on them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou make marriages with them, neither give thy daughter unto his son, nor take his daughter unto thy son.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they will cause thy son to turn away from me, and to serve other gods: then will the wrath of the Lord wax hot against you, and destroy thee suddenly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thus ye shall deal with them, Ye shall overthrow their altars, and break down their pillars, and ye shall cut down their groves, and burn their graven images with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art an holy people unto the Lord thy God, the Lord thy God hath chosen thee, to be a precious people unto himself, above all people that are upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord did not set his love upon you, nor chose you, because ye were more in number than any people: for ye were the fewest of all people:
speaker: Narrator

text: But because the Lord loved you, and because he would keep the oath which he had sworn unto your fathers, the Lord hath brought you out by a mighty hand, and delivered you out of the house of bondage from the hand of Pharaoh King of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou mayest know, that the Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy unto them that love him and keep his commandments, even to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: And rewardeth them to their face that hate him, to bring them to destruction: he will not defer to reward him that hateth him, to his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep thou therefore the commandments, and the ordinances, and the laws, which I command thee this day to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye hearken unto these laws, and observe and do them, then the Lord thy God shall keep with thee the covenant, and the mercy which he sware unto thy fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will love thee, and bless thee, and multiply thee: he will also bless the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy land, thy corn and thy wine, and thine oil, and the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep in the land, which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be blessed above all people: there shall be neither male nor female barren among you, nor among your cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the Lord will take away from thee all infirmities, and will put none of the evil diseases of Egypt (which thou knowest) upon thee, but will send them upon all that hate thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt therefore consume all people which the Lord thy God shall give thee: thine eye shall not spare them, neither shalt thou serve their gods, for that shall be thy destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou say in thine heart, These nations are more than I, how can I cast them out?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not fear them, but remember what the Lord thy God did unto Pharaoh, and unto all Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: The great tentations which thine eyes saw, and the signs and wonders, and the mighty hand and stretched out arm, whereby the Lord thy God brought thee out: so shall the Lord thy God do unto all the people, whose face thou fearest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the Lord thy God will send hornets among them until they that are left, and hide themselves from thee, be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not fear them: for the Lord thy God is among you, a God mighty and dreadful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God will root out these nations before thee by little and little: thou mayest not consume them at once, lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord thy God shall give them before thee, and shall destroy them with a mighty destruction, until they be brought to naught.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall deliver their Kings into thine hand, and thou shalt destroy their name from under heaven: there shall no man be able to stand before thee, until thou hast destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The graven images of their gods shall ye burn with fire, and covet not the silver and gold, that is on them, nor take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therewith: for it is an abomination before the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring not therefore abomination into thine house, lest thou be accursed like it, but utterly abhor it, and count it most abominable: for it is accursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall keep all the commandments which I command thee this day, for to do them: that ye may live, and be multiplied, and go in, and possess the land which the Lord sware unto your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt remember all the way which the Lord thy God led thee this forty years in the wilderness, for to humble thee, and to prove thee, to know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his commandments or no.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he humbled thee, and made thee hungry, and fed thee with Manna, which thou knewest not, neither did thy fathers know it, that he might teach thee that man lived not by bread only, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the Lord, doth a man live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy raiment waxed not old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell those forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore in thine heart, that as a man nurtureth his son, so the Lord thy God nurtureth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shalt thou keep the commandments of the Lord thy God, that thou mayest walk in his ways, and fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God bringeth thee into a good land, a land in the which are rivers of water and fountains, and depths that spring out of valleys and mountains:
speaker: Narrator

text: A land of wheat and barley, and of vineyards, and fig trees, and pomegranates: a land of oil, olive and honey:
speaker: Narrator

text: A land wherein thou shalt eat bread without scarcity, neither shalt thou lack anything therein: a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose mountains thou shalt dig brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when thou hast eaten and filled thyself, thou shalt bless the Lord thy God for the good land, which he hath given thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware that thou forget not the Lord thy God, not keeping his commandments and his laws, and his ordinances, which I command thee this day:
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest when thou hast eaten and filled thyself, and hast built goodly houses and dwelt therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy beasts, and the sheep are increased, and thy silver and gold is multiplied, and all that thou hast is increased;
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thine heart be lifted up and thou forget the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who was thy guide in that great and terrible wilderness (wherein were fiery serpents, and scorpions and drought, where was no water, who brought forth water for thee out of the rock of flint:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who fed thee in the wilderness with Manna, which thy fathers knew not) to humble thee, and to prove thee, that he might do thee good at the latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware lest thou say in thine heart, My power, and the strength of mine own hand hath prepared me this abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: But remember the Lord thy God: for it is he which giveth thee power to get substance to establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou forget the Lord thy God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify unto you this day, that ye shall surely perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the nations which the Lord destroyeth before you, so ye shall perish, because ye would not be obedient unto the voice of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O Israel, Thou shalt pass over Jordan this day, to go in and to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, and cities great and walled up to heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: A people great and tall, even the children of the Anakims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, Who can stand before the children of Anak?
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand therefore that this day the Lord thy God is he which goeth over before thee as a consuming fire: he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so thou shalt cast them out and destroy them suddenly, as the Lord hath said unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak not thou in thine heart (after that the Lord thy God hath cast them out before thee) saying, For my righteousness the Lord hath brought me in, to possess this land: but for the wickedness of these nations, the Lord hath cast them out before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou entrust not to inherit their land for thy righteousness, or for their upright heart, but for the wickedness of those nations, the Lord thy God doth cast them out before thee, and that he might perform the word which the Lord thy God sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understand therefore, that the Lord thy God giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy righteousness: for thou art a stiff-necked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember and forget not, how thou provokedst the Lord thy God to anger in the wilderness: since the day that thou didst depart out of the land of Egypt, until ye came into this place, ye have rebelled against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in Horeb ye provoked the Lord to anger, so that the Lord was wroth with you, even to destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I was gone up into the mount, to receive the Tables of stone, the Tables, I say, of the Covenant, which the Lord made with you: and I abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, and I neither ate bread nor yet drank water:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord delivered me two tables of stone, written with the finger of God, and in them was contained according to all the words which the Lord had said unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire, in the day of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the forty days and forty nights were ended, the Lord gave me the two tables of stone, the tables, I say, of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, Arise, get thee down quickly from hence: for thy people which thou hast brought out of Egypt, have corrupt their ways: they are soon turned out of the way which I commanded them, they have made them a molten image.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore the Lord spake unto me, saying, I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me alone, that I may destroy them, and put out their name from under heaven, and I will make of thee a mighty nation and greater than they be.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I returned, and came down from the mount (and the mount burnt with fire, and the two Tables of the Covenant were in my two hands.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I looked, and behold, ye had sinned against the Lord your God: for ye had made you a molten calf, and had turned quickly out of the way which the Lord had commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I took the two Tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I fell down before the Lord, forty days, and forty nights, as before: I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sins which ye had committed, in doing wickedly in the sight of the Lord, in that ye provoked him unto wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For I was afraid of the wrath and indignation, wherewith the Lord was moved against you, even to destroy you) yet the Lord heard me at that time also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the Lord was very angry with Aaron, even to destroy him: but at that time I prayed also for Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took your sin, I mean the calf which ye had made, and burnt him with fire, and stamped him and ground him small, even unto very dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the river, that descended out of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in Taberah, and in Massah, and in Kibroth Hattaavah ye provoked the Lord to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise when the Lord sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, Go up, and possess the land which I have given you, then ye rebelled against the commandment of the Lord your God, and believed him not, nor hearkened unto his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have been rebellious unto the Lord, since the day that I knew you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I fell down before the Lord forty days, and forty nights, as I fell down before, because the Lord had said that he would destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I prayed unto the Lord, and said, O Lord God, destroy not thy people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, whom thou hast brought out of Egypt by a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember thy servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: look not to the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest the country whence thou broughtest them, say, Because the Lord was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, or because he hated them, he carried them out to slay them in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they are thy people, and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty power, and by thy stretched out arm.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same time the Lord said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an Ark of wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will write upon the tables, the words that were upon the first Tables, which thou breakest, and thou shalt put them in the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I made an Ark of Shittim wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mountain, and the two Tables in mine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he wrote upon the Tables according to the first writing, (the ten commandments, which the Lord spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire, in the day of the assembly) and the Lord gave them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I departed and came down from the Mount, and put the Tables in the Ark which I had made: and there they be, as the Lord commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan, to Moserah, where Aaron died, and was buried, and Eleazar his son became Priest in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: From thence they departed unto Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of running waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same time the Lord separated the tribe of Levi to bear the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, and to stand before the Lord, to minister unto him, and to bless in his Name unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren: for the Lord is his inheritance, as the Lord thy God hath promised him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tarried in the mount, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights, and the Lord heard me at that time also, and the Lord would not destroy thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said unto me, Arise, go forth in the journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Israel, what doth the Lord thy God require of thee, but to fear the Lord thy God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul?
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou keep the commandments of the Lord and his ordinances, which I command thee this day, for thy wealth?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, heaven, and the heaven of heavens is the Lord’s thy God, and the earth, with all that therein is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, the Lord set his delight in thy fathers to love them, and did choose their seed after them, even you above all people, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and harden your necks no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, mighty and terrible, which accepteth no persons, nor taketh reward:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who doeth right unto the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, giving him food and raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God: thou shalt serve him, and thou shalt cleave unto him, and shalt swear by his Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is thy praise, and he is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons, and now the Lord thy God hath made thee, as the stars of the heaven in multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt love the Lord thy God and shalt keep that, which he commandeth to be kept: that is, his ordinances, and his laws and his commandments always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And consider this day (for I speak not to your children, which have neither known nor seen) the chastisements of the Lord your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his stretched out arm,
speaker: Narrator

text: And his signs, and his acts, which he did in the midst of Egypt, unto Pharaoh the King of Egypt and unto all his land:
speaker: Narrator

text: And what he did unto the host of the Egyptians, unto their horses, and to their chariots, when he caused the waters of the red Sea to overflow them, as they pursued after you, and the Lord destroyed them unto this day:
speaker: Narrator

text: And what he did unto you in the wilderness, until ye came unto this place:
speaker: Narrator

text: And what he did unto Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab the son of Reuben, when the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them with their households, and their tents, and all their substance that they had in the midst of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your eyes have seen all the great acts of the Lord which he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall ye keep all the commandments, which I command you this day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land whither ye go to possess it:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also that ye may prolong your days in the land, which the Lord sware unto your fathers, to give unto them and to their seed, even a land that floweth with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the land whither thou goest to possess it, is not as the land of Egypt, from whence ye came, where thou sowedst thy seed, and wateredst it with thy feet as a garden of herbs:
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land whither ye go to possess it, is a land of mountains and valleys, and drinketh water of the rain of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: This land doth the Lord thy God care for: the eyes of the Lord thy God are always upon it, from the beginning of the year, even unto the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye shall hearken therefore unto my commandments, which I command you this day, that ye love the Lord your God and serve him with all your heart, and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will give rain unto your land in due time, the first rain and the latter, that thou mayest gather in thy wheat, and thy wine, and thine oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will send grass in thy fields for thy cattle, that thou mayest eat, and have enough.
speaker: Narrator

text: But beware lest your heart deceive you, and lest ye turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so the anger of the Lord be kindled against you, and he shut up the heaven, that there be no rain, and that your land yield not her fruit, and ye perish quickly from the good land, which the Lord giveth you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall ye lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be as a frontlet between your eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall teach them your children, speaking of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt write them upon the posts of thine house, and upon thy gates,
speaker: Narrator

text: That your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which the Lord sware unto your fathers to give them, as long as the heavens are above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye keep diligently all these Commandments, which I command you to do: that is, to love the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cleave unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will the Lord cast out all these nations before you, and ye shall possess great nations and mightier than you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the places whereon the soles of your feet shall tread, shall be yours: your coast shall be from the wilderness and from Lebanon, and from the River even the river Perath, unto the uttermost Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man shall stand against you: for the Lord your God shall cast the fear and dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he hath said unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I set before you this day a blessing and a curse:
speaker: Narrator

text: The blessing, if ye obey the commandments of the Lord your God, which I command you this day:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the curse, if ye will not obey the Commandments of the Lord your God, but turn out of the way, which I command you this day, to go after other gods which ye have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord thy God therefore hath brought thee into the land, whither thou goest to possess it, then thou shalt put the blessing upon mount Gerizim, and the curse upon mount Ebal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they not beyond Jordan on that part, where the Sun goeth down in the land of the Canaanites, which dwell in the plain over against Gilgal, beside the grove of Moreh?
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall pass over Jordan, to go in to possess that land which the Lord your God giveth you, and ye shall possess it, and dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed therefore that ye do all the commandments and the laws, which I set before you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ordinances and the laws, which ye shall observe and do in the land, (which the Lord God of thy fathers giveth thee to possess it) as long as ye live upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall utterly destroy all the places wherein the nations which ye shall possess, served their gods upon the high mountains, and upon the hills, and under every green tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also ye shall overthrow their altars, and break down their pillars, and burn their groves with fire: and ye shall hew down the graven images of their gods, and abolish their names out of that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not do so unto the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall seek the place which the Lord your God shall choose out of your tribes, to put his Name there, and there to dwell, and thither thou shalt come,
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall bring thither your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and the offering of your hands, and your vows, and your free offerings, and the firstborn of your kine and of your sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there ye shall eat before the Lord your God, and ye shall rejoice in all that ye put your hand unto, both ye, and your households, because the Lord thy God hath blessed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not do after all these things that we do here this day: that is, every man whatsoever seemeth him good in his own eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye are not yet come to rest, and to the inheritance which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when ye go over Jordan, and dwell in the land, which the Lord your God hath given you to inherit, and when he hath given you rest from all your enemies round about, and ye dwell in safety,
speaker: Narrator

text: When there shall be a place which the Lord your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, thither shall ye bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, and the offering of your hands, and all your special vows which ye vow unto the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall rejoice before the Lord your God, ye, and your sons and your daughters, and your servants, and your maidens, and the Levite that is within your gates: for he hath no part nor inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou seest:
speaker: Narrator

text: But in the place which the Lord shall choose in one of thy tribes, there thou shalt offer thy burnt offerings, and there thou shalt do all that I command thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thy gates, whatsoever thine heart desireth, according to the blessing of the Lord thy God which he had given thee: both the unclean and the clean may eat thereof, as of the roebuck, and of the hart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only ye shall not eat the blood, but pour it upon the earth as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou mayest not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy corn, nor of thy wine, nor of thine oil, nor the firstborn of thy kine, nor of thy sheep, neither any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy free offerings, nor the offering of thine hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt eat it before the Lord thy God, in the place which the Lord thy God shall choose, thou and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy servant, and thy maid, and the Levite that is within thy gates: and thou shalt rejoice before the Lord thy God, in all that thou puttest thine hand to.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware, that thou forsake not the Levite, as long as thou livest upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord thy God shall enlarge thy border, as he hath promised thee, and thou shalt say, I will eat flesh (because thine heart longeth to eat flesh) thou mayest eat flesh, whatsoever thine heart desireth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the place which the Lord thy God hath chosen to put his Name there, be far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thy bullocks, and of thy sheep which the Lord hath given thee, as I have commanded thee, and thou shalt eat in thy gates, whatsoever thine heart desireth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as the roebuck, and the hart is eaten, so shalt thou eat them: both the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the life, and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt not eat it, but pour it upon the earth as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not eat it, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thine holy things which thou hast, and thy vows thou shalt take up, and come unto the place which the Lord shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make thy burnt offerings of the flesh, and of the blood upon the altar of the Lord thy God, and the blood of thine offerings shall be poured upon the altar of the Lord thy God, and thou shalt eat the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed, and hear all these words which I command thee, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee forever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord thy God shall destroy the nations before thee, whither thou goest to possess them, and thou shalt possess them and dwell in their land,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware, lest thou be taken in snare after them, after that they be destroyed before thee, and lest thou ask after their gods, saying, How did these nations serve their gods, that I may do so likewise?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not do so unto the Lord thy God: for all abomination, which the Lord hateth, have they done unto their gods: for they have burned both their sons and their daughters with fire to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore whatsoever I command you, take heed you do it: thou shalt put nothing thereto, nor take ought therefrom.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there arise among you a Prophet or a dreamer of dreams, (and give thee a sign or wonder,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sign and the wonder, which he hath told thee, come to pass) saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not hearken unto the words of the prophet, or unto that dreamer of dreams: for the Lord your God proveth you, to know whether you love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall walk after the Lord your God and fear him, and shall keep his commandments, and hearken unto his voice, and ye shall serve him, and cleave unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that Prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, he shall be slain, because he hath spoken to turn you away from the Lord your God (which brought you out of the land of Egypt, and delivered you out of the house of bondage) to thrust thee out of the way, wherein the Lord thy God commanded thee to walk: so shalt thou take the evil away forth of the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thine own son, or thy daughter, or the wife, that lieth in thy bosom, or thy friend, which is as thine own soul, entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, (which thou hast not known, thou I say, nor thy fathers)
speaker: Narrator

text: Any of the gods of the people which are round about you, near unto thee or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth unto the other:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not consent unto him, nor hear him, neither shall thine eye pity him, nor show mercy, nor keep him secret:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt even kill him: thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and then the hands of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt stone him with stones, that he die (because he hath gone about to thrust thee away from the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: from the house of bondage)
speaker: Narrator

text: That all Israel may hear and fear, and do no more any such wickedness as this among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt hear say (concerning any of thy cities, which the Lord thy God hath given thee to dwell in)
speaker: Narrator

text: Wicked men are gone out from among you, and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt seek, and make search and inquire diligently: and if it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt even slay the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword: destroy it utterly, and all that is therein, and the cattle thereof with the edge of the sword,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street thereof, and burn with fire the city and all the spoil thereof every whit, unto the Lord thy God: and it shall be an heap forever, it shall not be built again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall cleave nothing of the damned thing to thine hand, that the Lord may turn from the fierceness of his wrath, and show thee mercy, and have compassion on thee, and multiply thee as he hath sworn unto thy fathers:
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt obey the voice of the Lord thy God, and keep all his commandments which I command thee this day: that thou do that which is right in the eyes of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are the children of the Lord your God, Ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make you any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thou art an holy people unto the Lord thy God, and the Lord hath chosen thee to be a precious people unto himself, above all the people that are upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat no manner of abomination.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the beasts, which ye shall eat, the beef, the sheep, and the goat,
speaker: Narrator

text: The hart, and the roebuck, and the bugle, and the wild goat, and the unicorn, and the wild ox, and the Chamois.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws, and is of the beasts that cheweth the cud, that shall ye eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these ye shall not eat, of them that chew the cud, and of them that divide and cleave the hoof only: the camel, nor the hare, nor the coney: for they chew the cud, but divide not the hoof, therefore they shall be unclean unto you:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the swine, because he divideth the hoof: and cheweth not the cud, shall be unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: These ye shall eat, of all that are in the waters: all that have fins and scales shall ye eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whatsoever hath no fins nor scales, ye shall not eat: it shall be unclean unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all clean birds ye shall eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are they whereof ye shall not eat: the eagle nor the goshawk, nor the osprey,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor the glede, nor the kite, nor the vulture, after their kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor all kind of ravens,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor the ostrich, nor the night crow, nor the seamew, nor the hawk after her kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither the little owl, nor the great owl, nor the redshank,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor the pelican, nor the swan, nor the cormorant:
speaker: Narrator

text: The stork also, and the heron in his kind, nor the lapwing, nor the [bat].
speaker: Narrator

text: And every creeping thing that flieth, shall be unclean unto you: it shall not be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of all clean fowls ye may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall eat of nothing that dieth alone, but thou shalt give it unto the stranger that is within thy gates, that he may eat it: or thou mayest sell it unto a stranger: for thou art an holy people unto the Lord thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt give the tithe of all the increase of thy seed, that cometh forth of the field year by year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt eat before the Lord thy God (in the place which he shall choose to cause his Name to dwell there) the tithe of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the firstborn of thy kine, and of thy sheep, that thou mayest learn to fear the Lord thy God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it, because the place is far from thee, where the Lord thy God shall choose to set his name, when the Lord thy God shall bless thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou make it in money, and take the money in thine hand, and go unto the place which the Lord thy God shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bestow the money for whatsoever thine heart desireth: whether it be ox, or sheep, or wine, or strong drink, or whatsoever thine heart desireth: and shalt eat it there before the Lord thy God, and rejoice, both thou, and thine household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levite that is within thy gates, shalt thou not forsake: for he hath neither part nor inheritance with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithes of thine increase of the same year, and lay it up within thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Levite shall come, because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which are within thy gates, and shall eat, and be filled, that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the term of seven years thou shalt make a freedom,
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the manner of the freedom: every creditor shall quit the loan of his hand which he hath lent to his neighbor: he shall not ask it again of his neighbor, nor of his brother: for the year of the Lord’s freedom is proclaimed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a stranger thou mayest require it: but that which thou hast with thy brother, thine hand shall remit:
speaker: Narrator

text: Save when there shall be no poor with thee: for the Lord shall bless thee in the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee, for an inheritance to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that thou hearken unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe and do all these commandments, which I command thee this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God hath blessed thee, as he hath promised thee: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but thou thyself shalt not borrow, and thou shalt reign over many nations, and they shall not reign over thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If one of thy brethren with thee be poor within any of thy gates in thy land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt open thine hand unto him, and shalt lend him sufficient for his need which he hath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware that there be not a wicked thought in thine heart, to say, The seventh year, the year of freedom is at hand: therefore it grieveth thee to look on thy poor brother, and thou givest him nought, and he cry unto the Lord against thee, so that sin be in thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt give him, and let it not grieve thine heart to give unto him: for because of this the Lord thy God shall bless thee in all thy works, and in all that thou puttest thine hand to.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because there shall be ever some poor in the land, therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand unto thy brother, to thy needy, and to thy poor in thy land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy brother an Hebrew sell himself to thee, or an Hebrewess, and serve thee six years, even in the seventh year thou shalt let him go free from thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him go away empty,
speaker: Narrator

text: But shalt give him a liberal reward of thy sheep, and of thy corn, and of thy wine: thou shalt give him of that wherewith the Lord thy God hath blessed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and the Lord thy God delivered thee: therefore I command thee this thing today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he say unto thee, I will not go away from thee, because he loveth thee and thine house, and because he is well with thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou take an awl, and pierce his ear through against the door, and he shall be thy servant forever: and unto thy maid servant thou shall do likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let it not grieve thee, when thou lettest him go out free from thee: for he hath served thee six years, which is the double worth of an hired servant: and the Lord thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the firstborn males that come of thy cattle, and of thy sheep, thou shalt sanctify unto the Lord thy God. Thou shalt do no work with thy firstborn bullock, nor shear thy firstborn sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat it before the Lord thy God year by year, in the place which the Lord shall choose, both thou, and thine household.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if there be any blemish therein, as if it be lame, or blind, or have any evil fault, thou shalt not offer it unto the Lord thy God,
speaker: Narrator

text: But shalt eat it within thy gates: the unclean, and the clean shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only thou shalt not eat the blood thereof, but pour it upon the ground as water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep the month of Abib, and thou shalt celebrate the Passover unto the Lord thy God: for in the month of Abib the Lord thy God brought thee out of Egypt by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt therefore offer the Passover unto the Lord thy God, of sheep and bullocks in the place where the Lord shall choose to cause his Name to dwell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt eat no leavened bread with it: but seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread therewith, even the bread of tribulation: for thou camest out of the land of Egypt in haste: that thou mayest remember the day when thou camest out of the land of Egypt, all the days of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be no leaven seen with thee in all thy coasts seven days long: neither shall there remain the night any of the flesh until the morning which thou offeredst the first day at even.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou mayest not offer the Passover within any of the gates, which the Lord thy God giveth thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: But in the place which the Lord thy God shall choose to place his Name, there thou shalt offer the Passover at even, about the going down of the sun, in the season that thou camest out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the Lord thy God shall choose, and shalt return on the morrow, and go unto thy tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shalt thou eat unleavened bread, and the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the Lord thy God: thou shalt do no work therein.
