speaker: Narrator

text: Seven weeks shalt thou number unto thee, and shalt begin to number the seven weeks, when thou beginnest to put the sickle to the corn:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt keep the feast of weeks unto the Lord thy God, even a free gift of thine hand, which thou shalt give unto the Lord thy God, as the Lord thy God hath blessed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt rejoice before the Lord thy God, thou and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy servant, and thy maid, and the Levite that is within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the Lord thy God shall choose to place his Name there,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a servant in Egypt: therefore thou shalt observe and do these ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt observe the feast of the Tabernacles seven days, when thou hast gathered in thy corn, and thy wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy servant, and thy maid, and the Levite, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are within thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days shalt thou keep a feast unto the Lord thy God in the place which the Lord shall choose: when the Lord thy God shall bless thee in all thine increase, and in all the works of thine hands, thou shalt in any case be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year shall all the males appear before the Lord thy God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of the unleavened bread, and in the feast of the weeks, and in the feast of the Tabernacle: and they shall not appear before the Lord empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man shall give according to the gift of his hand, and according to the blessing of the Lord thy God, which he hath given thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judges and officers shalt thou make thee in all thy cities, which the Lord thy God giveth thee, throughout the tribes: and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wrest not thou the Law, nor respect any person, neither take reward: for the reward blindeth the eyes of the wise, and perverteth the words of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which is just and right shalt thou follow, that thou mayest live, and possess the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt plant thee no grove of any trees near unto the Altar of the Lord thy God, which thou shalt make thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt set thee up no pillar, which thing the Lord thy God hateth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt offer unto the Lord thy God no bullock nor sheep wherein is a blemish or any evil favored thing: for that is an abomination unto the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be found among you in any of thy cities, which the Lord thy God giveth thee, man or woman that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of the Lord thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them: as the sun, or the moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded,
speaker: Narrator

text: And it be told unto thee, and thou hast heard it, then shalt thou inquire diligently: and if it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou bring forth that man, or that woman (which hath committed that wicked thing) unto thy gates, whether it be man or woman, and shalt stone them with stones, till they die.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the mouth of two or three witnesses shall he that is worthy of death, die: but at the mouth of one witness, he shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hands of the witnesses shall be first upon him, to kill him: and afterward the hands of all the people: so thou shalt take the wicked away from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there rise a matter too hard for thee in judgment between blood and blood, between plea and plea, between plague and plague, in the matter of controversy within thy gates, then shalt thou arise, and go up unto the place which the Lord thy God shall choose,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt come unto the Priests of the Levites, and unto the Judge that shall be in those days, and ask, and they shall show thee the sentence of judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt do according to that thing, which they of that place (which the Lord hath chosen) show thee, and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the Law, which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, shalt thou do: thou shalt not decline from the thing which they shalt show thee, neither to the right hand, nor the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that man that will do presumptuously, not hearkening unto the Priest (that standeth before the Lord thy God to minister there) or unto the Judge, that man shall die, and thou shalt take away evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the people shall hear and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt come unto the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and dwell therein, if thou say, I will set a king over me, like as all the nations that are about me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt make him King over thee, whom the Lord thy God shall choose: from among thy brethren shalt thou make a King over thee: thou shalt not set a stranger over thee which is not thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: In any wise he shall not prepare him many horses, nor bring the people again to Egypt, for to increase the number of horses, seeing the Lord hath said unto you, Ye shall henceforth go no more again that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall he take him many wives, lest his heart turn away, neither shall he gather him much silver and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he shall sit upon the throne of his Kingdom, then shall he write him this law repeated in a book, by the Priest of the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all days of his life, that he may learn to fear the Lord his God, and to keep all the words of this Law, and these ordinances to do them:
speaker: Narrator

text: That his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not from the commandment, to the right hand or to the left, but that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his sons in the midst of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Priests of the Levites, and all the tribe of Levi shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel, but shall eat the offerings of the Lord made by fire, and his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall they have no inheritance among their brethren: for the Lord is their inheritance, as he hath said unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this shall be the Priest’s duty of the people, that they which offer sacrifice, whether it be bullock or sheep, shall give unto the Priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.
speaker: Narrator

text: The firstfruits also of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy sheep shalt thou give him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God hath chosen him out of all thy tribes, to stand and minister in the Name of the Lord, him, and his sons forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also when a Levite shall come out of any of thy cities of all Israel, where he remained, and come with all the desire of his heart unto the place, which the Lord shall choose,
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall then minister in the Name of the Lord his God, as all his brethren the Levites, which remain there before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall have like portions to eat beside that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt come into the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let none be found among you that maketh his son or his daughter to go thorough the fire, or that useth witchcraft, or a regarder of times, or a marker of the flying of fowls, or a sorcerer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Or a charmer, or that counseleth with spirits, or a soothsayer, or that asketh counsel at the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all that do such things are abomination unto the Lord, and because of these abominations the Lord thy God doth cast them out before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt be upright therefore with the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these nations which thou shalt possess, hearken unto those that regard the times, and unto sorcerers: as for thee, the Lord thy God hath not suffered thee so.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord thy God will raise up unto thee a Prophet like unto me, from among you, even of thy brethren: unto him ye shall hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that thou desiredst of the Lord thy God in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, when thou saidest, Let me hear the voice of my Lord God no more, nor see this great fire anymore, that I die not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, They have well spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will raise them up a Prophet from among their brethren like unto thee, and will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak unto them all that I shall command him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever will not hearken unto my words, which he shall speak in my Name, I will require it of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Prophet that shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that speaketh in the name of other gods, even the same Prophet shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou think in thine heart, How shall we know the word which the Lord hath not spoken?
speaker: Narrator

text: When a Prophet speaketh in the Name of the Lord, if the thing follow not nor come to pass, that is the thing which the Lord hath not spoken, but the Prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not therefore be afraid of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord thy God shall root out the nations, whose land the Lord thy God giveth thee, and thou shalt possess them, and dwell in their cities, and in their houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt separate three cities for thee, in the midst of thy land which the Lord thy God giveth thee to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt prepare thee the way, and divide the coasts of the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee thither.
speaker: Narrator

text: This also is the cause wherefore the manslayer shall flee thither, and live: who so killeth his neighbor ignorantly, and hated him not in time passed:
speaker: Narrator

text: As he that goeth unto the wood with his neighbor to hew wood, and his hand striketh with the axe to cut down the tree, if the head slip from the helve, and hit his neighbor that he dieth, the same shall flee unto one of the cities, and live,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest the avenger of the blood follow after the manslayer while his heart is chafed, and overtake him, because the way is long, and slay him, although he be not worthy of death, because he hated him not in time passed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt appoint out three cities for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord thy God enlargeth thy coasts (as he hath sworn unto thy fathers) and giveth thee all the land which he promised to give unto thy fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: (If thou keep all these commandments to do them, which I command thee this day: to wit, that thou love the Lord thy God, and walk in his ways forever) then thou shalt add three cities more for thee besides those three,
speaker: Narrator

text: That no innocent blood be shed within thy land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee to inherit, lest blood be upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a man hate his neighbor, and lay wait for him, and rise against him, and smite any man that he die, and flee unto any of these cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Elders of his city shall send and fet him thence, and deliver him to the hands of the avenger of the blood, that he may die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eye shall not spare him, but thou shalt put away the cry of innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not remove thy neighbor’s mark, which they of old time have set in thine inheritance, that thou shalt inherit in the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: One witness shall not rise against a man for any trespass, or for any sin, or for any fault that he offendeth in, but at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall the matter be stablished.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a false witness rise up against a man to accuse him of trespass,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then both the men which strive together, shall stand before the Lord, even before the Priests and the Judges, which shall be in those days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Judges shall make diligent inquisition: and if the witness be found false, and hath given false witness against his brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall ye do unto him as he had thought to do unto his brother: so thou shalt take evil away forth of the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest shall hear this, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such wickedness among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thine eye shall have no compassion, but life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt go forth to war against thine enemies, and shalt see horses and chariots, and people more than thou, be not afraid of them: for the Lord thy God is with thee, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye are come near unto the battle, then the Priest shall come forth to speak unto the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye are come this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, neither fear, nor be amazed, nor a dread of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God goeth with you, to fight for you against your enemies, and to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the officers speak unto the people, saying, What man is there that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it, let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what man is there that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not eaten of the fruit? let him go to return again unto his house, lest he die in the battle, and another eat the fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And what man is there that hath betrothed a wife, and hath not taken her? let him go and return again unto his house, lest he die in battle, and another man take her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the officers speak further unto the people, and say, Whosoever is afraid and faint hearted, let him go and return unto his house, lest his brethren’s heart faint like his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after that the officers have made an end of speaking unto the people, they shall make captains of the army to govern the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou comest near unto a city to fight against it, thou shalt offer it peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it answer thee again peaceably, and open unto thee, then let all the people that is found therein, be tributaries unto thee, and serve thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it will make no peace with thee, but make war against thee, then shalt thou besiege it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God shall deliver it into thine hands, and thou shalt smite all the males thereof with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the women, and the children, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, even all the spoil thereof shalt thou take unto thyself, and shalt eat the spoil of thine enemies, which the Lord thy God hath given thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shalt thou do unto all the cities, which are a great way off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations here.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of the cities of this people, which the Lord thy God shall give thee to inherit, thou shalt save no person alive,
speaker: Narrator

text: But shalt utterly destroy them, to wit, the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites: as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: That they teach you not to do after all their abominations, which they have done unto their gods, and so ye should sin against the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou hast besieged a city long time, and made war against it to take it, destroy not the trees thereof, by smiting an axe into them: for thou mayest eat of them: therefore thou shalt not cut them down to further thee in the siege, (for the tree of the field is man’s life).
speaker: Narrator

text: Only those trees which thou knowest are not for meat, those shalt thou destroy and cut down, and make forts against the city that maketh war with thee until thou subdue it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If one be found slain in the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee to possess it, lying in the field, and it is not known who hath slain him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thine Elders and thy Judges shall come forth, and measure unto the cities that are round about him that is slain:
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the Elders of that city, which is next unto the slain man, take out of the drove an heifer that hath not been put to labor, nor hath drawn in the yoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the Elders of that city bring the heifer unto a stony valley, which is neither eared, nor sown, and strike off the heifer’s neck there in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Priests the sons of Levi (whom the Lord thy God hath chosen to minister, and to bless in the Name of the Lord) shall come forth, and by their word shall all strife and plague be tried.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Elders of that city that came near to the slain man, shall wash their hands over the heifer that is beheaded in the valley:
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall testify, and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, be merciful unto thy people Israel, whom thou hast redeemed, and lay no innocent blood to the charge of thy people Israel, and the blood shall be forgiven them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shalt thou take away the cry of innocent blood from thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt go to war against thine enemies, and the Lord thy God shall deliver them into thine hands, and thou shalt take them captives,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt see among the captives a beautiful woman, and hast a desire unto her, and wouldest take her to thy wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt bring her home to thine house, and she shall shave her head, and pare her nails,
speaker: Narrator

text: And she shall put off the garment that she was taken in, and she shall remain in thine house, and bewail her father and her mother a month long: and after that shalt thou go in unto her, and marry her, and she shall be thy wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou have no favor unto her, then thou mayest let her go whither she will, but thou shalt not sell her for money, nor make merchandise of her, because thou hast humbled her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man have two wives, one loved and another hated, and they have born him children, both the loved and also the hated: if the firstborn be the son of the hated,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when the time cometh, that he appointeth his sons to be heirs of that which he hath, he may not make the son of the beloved firstborn before the son of the hated, which is the firstborn:
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall acknowledge the son of the hated for the firstborn, and give him double portion for all that he hath: for he is the first of his strength, and to him belongeth the right of firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man have a son that is stubborn and disobedient, which will not hearken unto the voice of his father, nor the voice of his mother, and they have chastened him, and he would not obey them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall his father and his mother take him, and bring him out unto the Elders of his city, and unto the gate of the place where he dwelleth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall say unto the Elders of his city, This our son is stubborn and disobedient, and he will not obey our admonition: he is a rioter, and a drunkard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the men of his city shall stone him with stones unto death: so thou shalt take away evil from among you, that all Israel may hear it, and fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man also have committed a trespass worthy of death, and is put to death, and thou hangest him on a tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt bury him the same day: for the curse of God is on him that is hanged. Defile not therefore thy land which the Lord thy God giveth thee to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not see thy brother’s ox nor his sheep go astray, and withdraw thyself from them, but shalt bring them again unto thy brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thy brother be not near unto thee, or if thou know him not, then thou shalt bring it into thine house, and it shall remain with thee, until thy brother seek after it, then shalt thou deliver it to him again:
speaker: Narrator

text: In like manner shalt thou do with his ass, and so shalt thou do with his raiment, and shalt so do with all lost things of thy brother, which he hath lost: if thou hast found them, thou shalt not withdraw thyself from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not see thy brother’s ass nor his ox fall down by the way, and withdraw thyself from them, but shalt lift them up with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman shall not wear that which pertaineth unto the man, neither shalt a man put on woman’s raiment: for all that do so, are abomination unto the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou find a bird’s nest in the way, in any tree, or on the ground whether they be young or eggs, and the dam sitting upon the young, or upon the eggs, thou shalt not take the dam with the young,
speaker: Narrator

text: But shalt in any wise let the dam go, and take the young to thee, that thou mayest prosper and prolong thy days.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou buildest a new house, thou shalt make a battlement on thy roof, that thou lay not blood upon thine house, if any man fall thence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not sow thy vineyard with divers kinds of seeds, lest thou defile the increase of the seed which thou hast sown, and the fruit of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not plow with an ox and an ass together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not wear a garment of divers sorts, as of woolen and linen together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make thee fringes upon the four quarters of thy vesture, wherewith thou coverest thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man take a wife, and when he hath lain with her, hate her,
speaker: Narrator

text: And lay slanderous things unto her charge, and bring up an evil name upon her, and say, I took this wife, and when I came to her, I found her not a maid,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the father of the maid and her mother take and bring the signs of the maid’s virginity unto the Elders of the city to the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the maid’s father shall say unto the Elders, I gave my daughter unto this man to wife and he hateth her:
speaker: Narrator

text: And lo, he layeth slanderous things unto her charge, saying, I found not thy daughter a maid: lo, these are the tokens of my daughter’s virginity: and they shall spread the vesture before the Elders of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Elders of the city shall take that man and chastise him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shall condemn him in an hundred shekels of silver, and give them unto the father of the maid, because he hath brought up an evil name upon a maid of Israel: and she shall be his wife, and he may not put her away all his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if this thing be true, that the maid be not found a virgin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall they bring forth the maid to the door of her father’s house, and the men of her city shall stone her with stones to death: for she hath wrought folly in Israel, by playing the whore in her father’s house: so thou shalt put evil away from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man be found lying with a woman married to a man, then they shall die even both twain: to wit, the man that lay with the wife, and the wife: so thou shalt put away evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a maid be betrothed unto a husband, and a man find her in the town and lie with her,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall ye bring them both out unto the gates of the same city, and shall stone them with stones to death: the maid because she cried not, being in the city, and the man, because he hath humbled his neighbor’s wife: so thou shalt put away evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a man find a betrothed maid in the field and force her, and lie with her, then the man that lay with her, shall die alone:
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the maid thou shalt do nothing, because there is in the maid no cause of death: for as when a man riseth against his neighbor and woundeth him to death, so is this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he found her in the fields: the betrothed maid cried, and there was no man to succor her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man find a maid that is not betrothed, and take her, and lie with her, and they be found,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man that lay with her, shall give unto the maid’s father fifty shekels of silver: and she shall be his wife, because he hath humbled her: he can not put her away all his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man shall take his father’s wife, nor shall uncover his father’s skirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: None that is hurt by bursting, or that hath his privy member cut off, shall enter into the Congregation of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bastard shall not enter into the Congregation of the Lord: even to his tenth generation shall he not enter into the Congregation of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Ammonites and the Moabites shall not enter into the Congregation of the Lord: even to their tenth generation shall they not enter into the Congregation of the Lord forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they met you not with bread and water in the way, when ye came out of Egypt, and because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor, of Pethor in Aram-naharaim, to curse thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the Lord thy God would not hearken unto Balaam, but the Lord thy God turned the curse to a blessing unto thee, because the Lord thy God loved thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shall not seek their peace, nor their prosperity all thy days forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite: for he is thy brother, neither shalt thou abhor an Egyptian, because thou wast a stranger in his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children that are begotten of them in their third generation, shall enter into the Congregation of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou goest out with the host against thine enemies, keep thee then from all wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be among you any that is unclean by that which cometh to him by night, he shall go out of the host, and shall not enter into the host,
speaker: Narrator

text: But at even he shall wash himself with water, and when the sun is down, he shall enter into the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have a place also without the host, whither thou shalt resort,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt have a paddle among thy weapons, and when thou wouldest sit down without, thou shalt dig therewith, and returning, thou shalt cover thine excrements.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp to deliver thee, and to give thee thine enemies before thee: therefore thine host shall be holy, that he see no filthy thing in thee, and turn away from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not deliver the servant unto his master, which is escaped from his master unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall dwell with thee, even among you, in what place he shall choose, in one of thy cities where it liketh him best: thou shalt not vex him.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be no whore of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a whore keeper of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt neither bring the hire of a whore, nor the price of a dog into the house of the Lord thy God for any vow: for even both these are abomination unto the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not give to usury to thy brother: as usury of money, usury of meat, usury of anything that is put to usury.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto a stranger thou mayest lend upon usury, but thou shalt not lend upon usury unto thy brother, that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all that thou settest thine hand to, in the land whither thou goest to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt vow a vow unto the Lord thy God, thou shalt not be slack to pay it: for the Lord thy God will surely require it of thee, and so it should be sin unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when thou abstainest from vowing, it shall be no sin unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: That which is gone out of thy lips, thou shalt keep and perform, as thou hast vowed it willingly unto the Lord thy God: for thou hast spoken it with thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou comest unto thy neighbor’s vineyard, then thou mayest eat grapes at thy pleasure, as much as thou wilt: but thou shalt put none in thy vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou comest unto thy neighbor’s corn, thou mayest pluck the ears with thine hand, but thou shalt not move a sickle to thy neighbor’s corn.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man taketh a wife, and marrieth her, if so be she find no favor in his eyes, because he hath espied some filthiness in her, then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and put it in her hand, and send her out of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she is departed out of his house, and gone her way, and marry with another man,
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the latter husband hate her, and write her a letter of divorcement, and put it in her hand, and send her out of his house, or if the latter man die which took her to wife:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then her first husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled: for that is abomination in the sight of the Lord, and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the Lord thy God doth give thee to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man taketh a new wife, he shall not go a warfare, neither shall be charged with any business, but shall be free at home one year, and rejoice with his wife, which he hath taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man shall take the nether nor the upper millstone to pledge: for this gage is his living.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man be found stealing any of his brethren of the children of Israel, and maketh merchandise of him, or selleth him, that thief shall die: so shalt thou put evil away from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed of the plague of leprosy, that thou observe diligently, and do according to all that the Priests of the Levites shall teach you: take heed ye do as I commanded them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what the Lord thy God did unto Miriam by the way after that ye were come out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou shalt ask again of thy neighbor anything lent, thou shalt not go into his house to fet his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt stand without, and the man that borrowed it of thee, shall bring the pledge out of the doors unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore if it be a poor body, thou shalt not sleep with his pledge,
speaker: Narrator

text: But shalt restore him the pledge when the sun goeth down, that he may sleep in his raiment, and bless thee: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant that is needy and poor, neither of thy brethren nor of the stranger that is in thy land within thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt give him his hire for his day, neither shall the sun go down upon it: for he is poor, and therewith sustaineth his life: lest he cry against thee unto the Lord, and it be sin unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, nor the children put to death for the fathers, but every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not pervert the right of the stranger, nor of the fatherless, nor take a widow’s raiment to pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: But remember that thou wast a servant in Egypt, and how the Lord thy God delivered thee thence. Therefore I command thee to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou cuttest down thine harvest in thy field, and hast forgotten a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fet it, but it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all the works of thine hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou beatest thine olive tree, thou shalt not go over the boughs again, but it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou gatherest thy vineyard, thou shalt not gather the grapes clean after thee, but they shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When there shall be strife between men, and they shall come unto judgment, and sentence shall be given upon them, and the righteous shall be justified, and the wicked condemned,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then if so be the wicked be worthy to be beaten, the judge shall cause him to lie down, and to be beaten before his face, according to his trespass unto a certain number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty stripes shall he cause him to have, and not past, lest if he should exceed and beat him above that with many stripes, thy brother should appear despised in thy sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn.
speaker: Narrator

text: If brethren dwell together, and one of them die and have no son, the wife of the dead shall not marry without, that is, unto a stranger, but his kinsman shall go in unto her, and take her to wife, and do the kinsman’s office to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the firstborn which she beareth, shall succeed in the name of his brother which is dead, that his name be not put out of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the man will not take his kinswoman, then let his kinswoman go up to the gate unto the Elders, and say, My kinsman refuseth to raise up unto his brother a name in Israel: he will not do the office of a kinsman unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Elders of the city shall call him, and commune with him: if he stand and say, I will not take her,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall his kinswoman come unto him in the presence of the Elders, and loose his shoe from his foot, and spit in his face, and answer, and say, So shall it be done unto that man that will not build up his brother’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his name shall be called in Israel, The house of him whose shoe is put off.
speaker: Narrator

text: When men strive together, one with another, if the wife of the one come near, for to rid her husband out of the hands of him that smiteth him, and put forth her hand, and take him by his privities,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt cut off her hand: thine eye shall not spare her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not have in thy bag two manner of weights, a great and a small:
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou have in thine house divers measures, a great and a small:
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt have a right and just weight: a perfect and a just measure shalt thou have, that thy days may be lengthened in the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all that do such things, and all that do unrighteously, are abomination unto the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what Amalek did unto thee by the way, when ye were come out of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: How he met thee by the way, and smote the hindmost of you, all that were feeble behind thee, when thou wast fainted and weary, and he feared not God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, when the Lord thy God hath given thee rest from all thine enemies round about in the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it, then thou shalt put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven: forget not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also when thou shalt come into the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee for inheritance, and shalt possess it, and dwell therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou take of the first of all the fruit of the earth, and bring it out of the land that the Lord thy God giveth thee, and put it in a basket, and go unto the place which the Lord thy God shall choose, to place his name there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt come unto the Priest, that shall be in those days, and say unto him, I acknowledge this day unto the Lord thy God, that I am come unto the country which the Lord sware unto our fathers for to give us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Priest shall take the basket out of thine hand, and set it down before the altar of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt answer and say before the Lord thy God, A Syrian was my father, who being ready to perish for hunger, went down into Egypt, and sojourned there with a small company and grew there unto a nation great, mighty and full of people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians vexed us, and troubled us, and laded us with cruel bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when we cried unto the Lord God of our fathers, the Lord heard our voice, and looked on our adversity, and on our labor, and on our oppression:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord brought us out of Egypt in a mighty hand, and stretched out arm, with great terribleness, both in signs and wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath brought us into this place, and hath given us this land, even a land that floweth with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, lo, I have brought the firstfruits of the land, which thou, O Lord, hast given me, and thou shalt set it before the Lord thy God, and worship before the Lord thy God:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt rejoice in all the good things which the Lord thy God hath given unto thee, and to thine household, thou and the Levite, and the stranger that is among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou hast made an end of tithing all the tithes of thine increase, the third year, which is the year of tithing, and hast given it unto the Levite, to the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widow, that they may eat within thy gates, and be satisfied,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say before the Lord thy God, I have brought the hallowed thing out of mine house, and also have given it to the Levites and to the strangers, to the fatherless and to the widow, according to all thy commandments which thou hast commanded me: I have transgressed none of the commandments, nor forgotten them,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not eaten thereof in my mourning, nor suffered ought to perish through uncleanness, nor given ought thereof for the dead, but have hearkened unto the voice of the Lord my God: I have done after all that thou hast commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from thine holy habitation, even from heaven, and bless thy people Israel, and the land which thou hast given us (as thou swarest unto our fathers) the land that floweth with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day the Lord thy God doth command thee to do these ordinances and laws: keep them therefore, and do them with all thine heart, and with all thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast set up the Lord this day to be thy God, and to walk in his ways, and to keep his ordinances, and his commandments, and his laws, and to hearken unto his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath set thee up this day, to be a precious people unto him (as he hath promised thee) and that thou shouldest keep all his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to make thee high above all nations (which he hath made) in praise, and in name, and in glory, and that thou shouldest be an holy people unto the Lord thy God, as he hath said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses with the Elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, Keep all the commandments, which I command you this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye shall pass over Jordan unto the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee, thou shalt set thee up great stones, and plaster them with plaster,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt write upon them all the words of this Law, when thou shalt come over, that thou mayest go into the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee: a land that floweth with milk and honey, as the Lord God of thy fathers hath promised thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when ye shall pass over Jordan, ye shall set up these stones, which I command you this day in mount Ebal, and thou shalt plaster them with plaster.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shalt thou build unto the Lord thy God an altar, even an altar of stones: thou shalt lift none iron instrument upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make the altar of the Lord thy God of whole stones, and offer burnt offerings thereon unto the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt offer peace offerings, and shalt eat there and rejoice before the Lord thy God:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt write upon the stones all the words of this Law, well and plainly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses and the Priests of the Levites, spake unto all Israel, saying, Take heed and hear, O Israel: this day thou art become the people of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt hearken therefore unto the voice of the Lord thy God, and do his commandments and his ordinances, which I command thee this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses charged the people the same day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: These shall stand upon mount Gerizim, to bless the people when ye shall pass over Jordan: Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these shall stand upon mount Ebal, to curse: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites shall answer and say unto all the men of Israel with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be the man that shall make any carved or molten image, which is an abomination unto the Lord, the work of the hands of the craftsman, and putteth it in a secret place: And all the people shall answer and say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that curseth his father and his mother: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that removeth his neighbor’s mark: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that maketh the blind go out of the way: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that hindereth the right of the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that lieth with his father’s wife: for he hath uncovered his father’s skirt: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that lieth with any beast: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that lieth with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that lieth with his mother-in-law: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that smiteth his neighbor secretly: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that taketh a reward to put to death innocent blood: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed be he that confirmeth not all the words of this Law, to do them: And all the people shall say: So be it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou shalt obey diligently the voice of the Lord thy God, and observe and do all his commandments, which I command thee this day, then the Lord thy God will set thee on high above all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all these blessings shall come on thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt obey the voice of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed shalt thou be in the city, and blessed also in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed shall be thy basket and thy dough.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and blessed also when thou goest out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall cause thine enemies that rise against thee, to fall before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and shall flee before thee seven ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall command the blessing to be with thee in thy store houses, and in all that thou settest thine hand to, and will bless thee in the land which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall make thee an holy people unto himself, as he hath sworn unto thee, if thou shalt keep the commandments of the Lord thy God, and walk in his ways,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all people of the earth shall see that the Name of the Lord is called upon over thee, and they shall be afraid of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall make thee plenteous in goods, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, in the land which the Lord swore unto thy fathers, to give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall open unto thee his good treasure, even the heaven to give rain unto thy land in due season, and to bless all the work of thine hands: and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but shalt not borrow thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall make thee the head, and not the tail, and thou shalt be above only, and shalt not be beneath, if thou obey the commandments of the Lord thy God which I command thee this day, to keep and to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt not decline from any of the words, which I command you this day, either to the right hand or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou wilt not obey the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep and to do all his commandments, and his ordinances, which I command thee this day, then all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed shalt thou be in the town, and cursed also in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed shall thy basket be, and thy dough.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cursed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and cursed also when thou goest out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall send upon thee cursing, trouble, and shame, in all that which thou settest thine hand to do, until thou be destroyed, and perish quickly, because of the wickedness of thy works, whereby thou hast forsaken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall make the pestilence cleave unto thee, until he hath consumed thee from the land, whither thou goest to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall smite thee with a consumption, and with the fever, and with a burning ague, and with fervent heat, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with the mildew, and they shall pursue thee until thou perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thine heaven that is over thine head, shall be brass, and the earth that is under thee, iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall give thee for the rain of thy land, dust and ashes: even from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall cause thee to fall before thine enemies: thou shalt come out one way against them, and shalt flee seven ways before them, and shalt be scattered through all the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy carcass shall be meat unto all fowls of the air, and unto the beasts of the earth, and none shall fray them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will smite thee with the botch of Egypt, and with the hemorrhoids, and with the scab, and with the itch, that thou canst not be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with atoning of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also grope at noon days, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and shalt not prosper in thy ways: thou shalt never but be oppressed with wrong, and be powled evermore, and no man shall succor thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: thou shalt build an house, and shalt not dwell therein: thou shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not eat the fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine ox shall be slain before thine eyes, and thou shalt not eat thereof: thine ass shall be violently taken away before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep shall be given unto thine enemies, and no man shall rescue them for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy sons and thy daughters shall be given unto another people, and thine eyes shall still look for them, even till they fall out, and there shall be no power in thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fruit of thy land and all thy labors shall a people which thou knowest not, eat, and thou shalt never but suffer wrong, and violence always:
speaker: Narrator

text: So that thou shalt be mad for the sight which thine eyes shall see.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall smite thee in the knees, and in the thighs, with a sore botch, that thou canst not be healed: even from the sole of the foot unto the top of thine head.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall bring thee and thy King (which thou shalt set over thee) unto a nation, which neither thou nor thy fathers have known, and there thou shalt serve other gods: even wood and stone,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt be a wonder, a proverb and a common talk among all people, whither the Lord shall carry thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt carry out much seed into the field, and shalt gather but little in: for the grasshoppers shall destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt plant a vineyard, and dress it, but shalt neither drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes: for the worms shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have Olive trees in all thy coasts, but shalt not anoint thyself with the oil: for thine olives shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt beget sons and daughters, but shalt not have them: for they shall go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy trees and fruit of thy land shall the grasshopper consume.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stranger that is among you, shall climb above thee up on high, and thou shalt come down beneath alow.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall lend thee, and thou shalt not lend him: he shall be the head, and thou shalt be the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee and overtake thee, till thou be destroyed, because thou obeyedst not the voice of the Lord thy God, to keep his commandments, and his ordinances, which he commanded thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be upon thee for signs and wonders, and upon thy seed forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou servedst not the Lord thy God with joyfulness, and with a good heart, for the abundance of all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt serve thine enemies which the Lord shall send upon thee, in hunger and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in need of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck until he have destroyed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall bring a nation upon thee from far, even from the end of the world, flying swift as an eagle: a nation whose tongue thou shalt not understand:
speaker: Narrator

text: A nation of a fierce countenance, which will not regard the person of the old, nor have compassion of the young.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same shall eat the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy land, until thou be destroyed, and he shall leave thee neither wheat, wine, nor oil, neither the increase of thy kine, nor the flocks of thy sheep, until he have brought thee to naught.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall besiege thee in all thy cities, until thine high and strong walls fall down, wherein thou trustedst in all the land: and he shall besiege thee in all thy cities throughout all thy land, which the Lord thy God hath given thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt eat the fruit of thy body, even the flesh of thy sons and thy daughters, which the Lord thy God hath given thee, during the siege and straitness wherein thine enemies shall enclose thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the man (that is tender and exceeding dainty among you,) shall be grieved at his brother, and at his wife that lieth in his bosom, and at the remnant of his children, which he hath yet left,
speaker: Narrator

text: For fear of giving unto any of them of the flesh of his children, whom he shall eat, because he hath nothing left him in that siege, and straitness, wherewith thine enemy shall besiege thee in all thy cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tender and dainty woman among you, which never would venture to set the sole of her foot upon the ground (for her softness and tenderness) shall be grieved at her husband that lieth in her bosom, and at her son, and at her daughter,
speaker: Narrator

text: And at her afterbirth (that shall come out from between her feet) and at her children, which she shall bear: for when all things lack, she shall eat them secretly, during the siege and straightness wherewith thine enemy shall besiege thee in thy cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou wilt not keep and do all the words of the Law (that are written in this book) and fear this glorious and fearful Name, THE LORD THY GOD,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance, and sore diseases and of long durance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he will bring upon thee all the diseases of Egypt, whereof thou wast afraid, and they shall cleave unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every sickness, and every plague, which is not written in the book of this Law, will the Lord heap upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall be left few in number, where ye were as the stars of heaven in multitude, because thou wouldest not obey the voice of the Lord thy God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the Lord hath rejoiced over you, to do you good, and to multiply you, so he will rejoice over you, to destroy you, and bring you to naught, and ye shall be rooted out of the land, whither thou goest to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall scatter thee among all people from the one end of the world unto the other, and there thou shalt serve other gods, which thou hast not known, nor thy fathers, even wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also among these nations thou shalt find no rest, neither shall the sole of thy foot have rest: for the Lord shall give thee there a trembling heart, and looking to return till thine eyes fall out, and a sorrowful mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thy life shall hang before thee, and thou shalt fear both night and day, and shalt have none assurance of thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning thou shalt say, Would God it were evening, and at the evening thou shalt say, Would God it were morning, for the fear of thine heart, which thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eyes, which thou shalt see.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall bring thee into Egypt again with ships by the way, whereof I said unto thee, Thou shalt see it no more again: and there ye shall sell yourselves unto your enemies for bondmen and bondwomen, and there shall be no buyer.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the words of the covenant which the Lord commandeth Moses to make with the children of Israel, in the land of Moab, beside the covenant which he had made with them in Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called all Israel, and said unto them, Ye have seen all that the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt unto Pharaoh and unto all his servants, and unto all his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: The great tentations which thine eyes have seen, those great miracles and wonders:
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Lord hath not given you an heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxed old upon you, neither is thy shoe waxed old upon thy foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have eaten no bread, neither drunk wine, nor strong drink, that ye might know how that I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, ye came unto this place, and Sihon King of Heshbon, and Og King of Bashan came out against us unto battle, and we slew them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep therefore the words of this covenant and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye shall do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye stand this day everyone of you before the Lord your God: your heads of your tribes, your Elders and your officers, even all the men of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: Your children, your wives, and thy stranger that is in thy camp, from the hewer of thy wood, unto the drawer of thy water,
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou shouldest pass into the covenant of the Lord thy God, and into his oath which the Lord thy God maketh with thee this day,
speaker: Narrator

text: For to establish thee this day a people unto himself, and that he may be unto thee a God, as he hath said unto thee, and as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither make I this covenant and this oath with you only,
speaker: Narrator

text: But as well with him that standeth here with us this day before the Lord our God, as with him that is not here with us this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye know, how we have dwelt in the land of Egypt, and how we passed through the midst of the nations, which ye passed by.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye have seen their abominations and their idols (wood and stone, silver and gold) which were among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: That there should not be among you man nor woman, nor family, nor tribe, which should turn his heart away this day from the Lord our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations, and that there should not be among you any root that bringeth forth gall and wormwood,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that when he heareth the words of this curse, he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, although I walk according to the stubbornness of mine own heart, thus adding drunkenness to thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will not be merciful unto him, but then the wrath of the Lord and his jealousy shall smoke against that man, and every curse that is written in this book, shall light upon him, and the Lord shall put out his name from under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall separate him unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according unto all the curses of the covenant, that is written in the book of this Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the generation to come, even your children, that shall rise up after you, and the stranger that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they shall see the plagues of this land, and the diseases thereof, wherewith the Lord shall smite it:
speaker: Narrator

text: (For all that land shall burn with brimstone and salt: it shall not be sown, nor bring forth, nor any grass shall grow therein, like as in the overthrowing of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, which the Lord overthrew in his wrath and in his anger.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall all nations say, Wherefore hath the Lord done thus unto this land? how fierce is this great wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall answer, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord God of their fathers, which he had made with them, when he brought them out of the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: And went and served other gods and worshipped them: even gods which they knew not, and which had given them nothing,
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the wrath of the Lord waxed hot against this land, to bring upon it every curse that is written in this book.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and hath cast them into another land, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong unto us, and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all these things shall come upon thee, either the blessing or the curse which I have set before thee, and thou shalt turn into thine heart, among all the nations whither the Lord thy God hath driven thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt return unto the Lord thy God, and obey his voice in all that I command thee this day: thou, and thy children with all thine heart and with all thy soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord thy God will cause thy captives to return, and have compassion upon thee, and will return, to gather thee out of all the people where the Lord thy God hath scattered thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though thou werest cast unto the utmost part of heaven, from thence will the Lord thy God gather thee, and from thence will he take thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God will bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed, and thou shalt possess it, and he will show thee favor, and will multiply thee above thy fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God will circumcise thine heart, and the heart of thy seed, that thou mayest love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, that thou mayest live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God will lay all these curses upon thine enemies, and on them that hate thee, and that persecute thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return thou therefore, and obey the voice of the Lord, and do all his commandments, which I command thee this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord thy God will make thee plenteous in every work of thine hand, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of the land for thy wealth: for the Lord will turn again, and rejoice over thee to do thee good, as he rejoiced over thy fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou shalt obey the voice of the Lord thy God, in keeping his commandments and his ordinances, which are written in the book of this law, when thou shalt return unto the Lord thy God with all thine heart and with all thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this commandment which I command thee this day, is not hid from thee, neither is it far off.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not in heaven, that thou shouldest say, Who shall go up for us to heaven, and bring it us, and cause us to hear it, that we may do it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither is it beyond the sea, that thou shouldest say, Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it us, and cause us to hear it, that we may do it?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word is very near unto thee: even in thy mouth, and in thine heart, for to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have set before thee this day life and good, death and evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: In that I command thee this day, to love the Lord thy God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandment, and his ordinances, and his laws, that thou mayest live, and be multiplied, and that the Lord thy God may bless thee in the land, whither thou goest to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thine heart turn away, so that thou wilt not obey, but shalt be seduced and worship other gods, and serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: I pronounce unto you this day, that ye shall surely perish, ye shall not prolong your days in the land, whither thou passest over Jordan to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth to record this day against you, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing: therefore choose life, that both thou and thy seed may live,
speaker: Narrator

text: By loving the Lord thy God, by obeying his voice, and by cleaving unto him: for he is thy life, and the length of thy days, that thou mayest dwell in the land which the Lord sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went and spake these words unto all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto them, I am an hundred and twenty years old this day: I can no more go out and in: also the Lord hath said unto me, Thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord thy God he will go over before thee: he will destroy these nations before thee, and thou shalt possess them. Joshua, he shall go before thee, as the Lord hath said.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall do unto them, as he did to Sihon and to Og kings of the Amorites, and unto their land whom he destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall give them before you, that ye may do unto them according unto every commandment which I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pluck up your hearts therefore, and be strong: dread not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God himself doth go with thee: he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses called Joshua, and said unto him in the sight of all Israel, Be of a good courage and strong: for thou shalt go with this people unto the land which the Lord hath sworn unto their fathers, to give them, and thou shalt give it them to inherit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord himself doth go before thee: he will be with thee: he will not fail thee, neither forsake thee: fear not therefore, nor be discomforted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses wrote this Law, and delivered it unto the Priests the sons of Levi (which bare the Ark of the covenant of the Lord) and unto all the Elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses commanded them, saying, Every seventh year when the year of freedom shall be in the feast of the Tabernacles:
speaker: Narrator

text: When all Israel shall come to appear before the Lord thy God, and the place which he shall choose, thou shalt read this Law before all Israel that they may hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather the people together: men, and women, and children, and thy stranger that is within thy gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear the Lord your God, and keep and observe all the words of this Law,
speaker: Narrator

text: And that their children which have not known it, may hear it, and learn to fear the Lord your God, as long as ye live in the land, whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Behold, thy days are come, that thou must die: Call Joshua, and stand ye in the Tabernacle of the Congregation that I may give him a charge. So Moses and Joshua went, and stood in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appeared in the Tabernacle in the pillar of a cloud: and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Behold, thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, and this people will rise up, and go a whoring after the gods of a strange land (whither they go to dwell therein) and will forsake me: and break my covenant which I have made with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore my wrath will wax hot against them at that day, and I will forsake them, and will hide my face from them: then they shall be consumed, and many adversities and tribulations shall come upon them: so then they will say, Are not these troubles come upon me, because God is not with me?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will surely hide my face in that day, because of all the evil which they shall commit, in that they are turned unto other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore write ye this song for you, and teach it the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, that this song may be my witness against the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will bring them into the land (which I sware unto their fathers) that floweth with milk and honey: and they shall eat and fill themselves, and wax fat: then shall they turn unto other gods, and serve them, and contemn me, and break my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then when many adversities and tribulations shall come upon them, this song shall answer them to their faces as a witness: for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their posterity: for I know their imagination, which they go about even now, before I have brought them into the land which I sware.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of Israel into the land, which I sware unto them, and I will be with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this Law in a book until he had finished them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded the Levites, which bare the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the book of this Law, and put ye it in the side of the Ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, that it may be there for a witness against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know thy rebellion and thy stiff neck: behold, I being yet alive with you this day, ye are rebellious against the Lord: how much more then after my death?
speaker: Narrator

text: Gather unto me all the Elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their audience, and call heaven and earth to record against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am sure that after my death, ye will utterly be corrupt and turn from the way which I have commanded you: therefore evil will come upon you at the length, because ye will commit evil in the sight of the Lord, by provoking him to anger through the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Moses spake in the audience of all the Congregation of Israel the words of this song, until he had ended them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, ye heavens, and I will speak: and let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: My doctrine shall drop as the rain, and my speech shall still as the dew, as the shower upon the herbs, and as the great rain upon the grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will publish the Name of the Lord: give ye glory unto our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Perfect is the work of the mighty God: for all his ways are judgment. God is true, and without wickedness: just and righteous is he.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have corrupted themselves toward him by their vice, not being his children, but a froward and crooked generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do ye so reward the Lord, O foolish people and unwise? is not he thy father, that hath bought thee? he hath made thee, and proportioned thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the days of old: consider the years of so many generations: ask thy father, and he will show thee: thine Elders, and they will tell thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the most high God divided to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the sons of Adam, he appointed the borders of the people, according to the number of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord’s portion is his people: Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: He found him in the land of the wilderness, in a waste and roaring wilderness: he led him about, he taught him, and kept him as the apple of his eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: As an eagle stirreth up her nest, fluttereth over her birds, stretcheth out her wings, taketh them and beareth them on her wings,
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord alone led him, and there was no strange god with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He carried him up to the high places of the earth, that he might eat the fruits of the fields, and he caused him to suck honey out of the stone, and oil out of the hard rock:
speaker: Narrator

text: Butter of kine, and milk of sheep with fat of the lambs, and rams fed in Bashan, and goats, with the fat of the grains of wheat: and the red liquor of the grape hast thou drunk.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that should have been upright, when he waxed fat, spurned with his heel: thou art fat, thou art gross, thou art laden with fatness: therefore he forsook God that made him, and regarded not the strong God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: They provoked him with strange gods: they provoked him to anger with abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text: They offered unto devils, not to God, but to gods whom they knew not: new gods that came newly up, whom their fathers feared not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast forgotten the mighty God, that begat thee, and hast forgotten God that formed thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord then saw it, and was angry, for the provocation of his sons and of his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, I will hide my face from them: I will see what their end shall be: for they are a froward generation, children in whom is no faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God: they have provoked me to anger with their vanities: and I will move them to jealousy with those which are no people: I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For fire is kindled in my wrath, and shall burn unto the bottom of hell, and shall consume the earth with her increase, and set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will spend plagues upon them: I will bestow mine arrows upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be burnt with hunger, and consumed with heat, and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the venom of serpents creeping in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sword shall kill them without, and in the chambers fear: both the young man and the young woman, the suckling with the man of gray hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said, I would scatter them abroad: I would make their remembrance to cease from among men,
speaker: Narrator

text: Save that I feared the fury of the enemy, lest their adversaries should wax proud, and lest they should say, Our high hand and not the Lord hath done all this.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are a nation void of counsel, neither is there any understanding in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that they were wise, then they would understand this: they would consider their latter end.
speaker: Narrator

text: How should one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their strong God had sold them, and the Lord had shut them up?
speaker: Narrator

text: For their god is not as our God, even our enemies being judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom, and of the vines of Gomorrah: their grapes are grapes of gall, their clusters be bitter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their wine is the poison of dragons, and the cruel gall of asps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this laid in store with me, and sealed up among my treasures?
speaker: Narrator

text: Vengeance and recompense are mine: their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their destruction is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them, make haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord shall judge his people, and repent toward his servants, when he seeth that their power is gone, and none shut up in hold nor left abroad.
speaker: Narrator

text: When men shall say, Where are their gods, their mighty God, in whom they trusted,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and did drink the wine of their drink offering? let them rise up, and help you: let him be your refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold now, for I, I am he, and there is no gods with me: I kill, and give life: I wound, and I make whole: neither is there any that can deliver out of mine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I lift up mine hand to heaven, and say, I live forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I whet my glittering sword, and mine hand take hold on judgment, I will execute vengeance on mine enemies, and will reward them that hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, (and my sword shall eat flesh) for the blood of the slain, and of the captives, when I begin to take vengeance of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye nations, praise his people: for he will avenge the blood of his servants, and will execute vengeance upon his adversaries, and will be merciful unto his land, and to his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses came and spake all the words of this song in the audience of the people, he and Hoshea the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator
