text: When Moses had made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify against you this day, that ye may command them unto your children, that they may observe and do all the words of this Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is no vain word concerning you, but it is your life, and by this word ye shall prolong your days in the land, whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto Moses the selfsame day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up into the mountain of Abarim, unto the mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho: and behold the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel for a possession,
speaker: Narrator

text: And die in the mount which thou goest up unto, and thou shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor, and was gathered unto his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye trespassed against me among the children of Israel, at the waters of Meribah, at Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin: for ye sanctified me not among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt therefore see the land before thee, but shalt not go thither, I mean, into the land which I give the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the blessing wherewith Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death, and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord came from Sinai, and rose up from Seir unto them, and appeared clearly from mount Paran, and he came with ten thousands of Saints, and at his right hand a fiery Law for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though he love the people, yet all thy Saints are in thine hands: and they are humbled at thy feet, to receive thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded us a Law for an inheritance of the Congregation of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he was among the righteous people, as King, when the heads of the people, and the tribes of Israel were assembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let Reuben live, and not die, though his men be a small number.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus he blessed Judah, and said, Hear, O Lord, the voice of Judah, and bring him unto his people: his hands shall be sufficient for him, if thou help him against his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Levi he said, Let thy Thummim and thine Urim be with thine Holy one, whom thou didst prove in Massah, and didst cause him to strive at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who said unto his father and to his mother, I have not seen him, neither knew he his brethren, nor knew his own children: for they observed thy word, and kept thy Covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall teach Jacob thy judgments, and Israel thy Law: they shall put incense before thy face, and the burnt offering upon thine Altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bless, O Lord, his substance, and accept the work of his hands: smite through the loins of them that rise against him, and of them that hate him, that they rise not again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Benjamin he said, The beloved of the Lord shall dwell in safety by him: the Lord shall cover him all the day long, and dwell between his shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Joseph he said, Blessed of the Lord is his land for the sweetness of heaven, for the dew, and for the depth lying beneath,
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the sweet increase of the Sun, and for the sweet increase of the Moon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And for thy sweetness of the top of the ancient mountains, and for the sweetness of the old hills,
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the sweetness of the earth, and abundance therefore: and the good will of him that dwelt in the bush, shall come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the top of the head of him that was separated from his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: His beauty shall be like his firstborn bullock, and his horns as the horns of an unicorn: with them he shall smite the people together, even the ends of the world: these are also the ten thousands of Ephraim, and these are the thousands of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out, and thou Issachar in thy tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall call the people unto the mountain: there they shall offer the sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck of the abundance of the sea, and of the treasures hid in the sand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also of Gad he said, Blessed be he that enlargeth Gad: he dwelleth as a lion, that catcheth for his prey the arm with the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked to himself at the beginning, because there was a portion of the Law-giver hid: yet he shall come with the heads of the people, to execute the justice of the Lord, and his judgments with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Dan he said, Dan is a lion’s whelp: he shall leap from Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, satisfied with favor, and filled with the blessing of the Lord, possess the West and the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Asher he said, Asher shall be blessed with children: he shall be acceptable unto his brethren, and shall dip his foot in oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy shoes shall be iron and brass, and thy strength shall continue as long as thou livest.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is none like God, O righteous people, which rideth upon the heavens for thine help, and on the clouds in his glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eternal God is thy refuge, and under his arms thou art forever: he shall cast out the enemy before thee, and will say, Destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Israel the fountain of Jacob shall dwell alone in safety in a land of wheat and wine: also his heavens shall drop the dew.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed art thou, O Israel: who is like unto thee, O people saved by the Lord, the shield of thine help, and which is the sword of thy glory? therefore thine enemies shall be in subjection to thee, and thou shalt tread upon their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went from the plain of Moab up into mount Nebo unto the top of Pisgah that is over against Jericho: and the Lord showed him all the land of Gilead, unto Dan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, unto the utmost sea:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the South, and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, unto Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto him, This is the land which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac and to Jacob, saying, I will give it unto thy seed: I have caused thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses the servant of the Lord died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he buried him in a valley in the land of Moab over against Beth Peor, but no man knoweth of his sepulcher unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was now an hundred and twenty years old when he died, his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plain of Moab thirty days: so the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom: for Moses had put his hands upon him. And the children of Israel were obedient unto him, and did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there arose not a Prophet since in Israel like unto Moses (whom the Lord knew face to face.)
speaker: Narrator

text: In all the miracles and wonders which the Lord sent him to do in the land of Egypt before Pharaoh and before all his servants, and before all his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all that mighty hand and all that great fear, which Moses wrought in the sight of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator
